result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert P Gardner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with: Concurrent with La Crosse Co cases 22CF43 & 21CM431, with conditions also concurrent
.

miscConds.notes:
Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random testing

No bars or taverns

The defendant is not to be at any locations where illicit drugs or controlled substances are kept, used, sold or distributed
.

Comply with any other conditions/programming deemed necessary by the Agent

Court costs/fees are imposed but REMITTED by the Court

Pay DOC Supervision fees - to be paid directly to the Dept of Corrections

Credit for 88 days if probation is ever revoked
.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
